title: eristica.com
author: eristica.com
content: One user in a conversation told me that one of the admins has a lot of bitcoins that belong to the forum or to him (I still don't understand).If these are the forum's Bitcoins? At the current rate, this is 120 million dollars. Why then doesn't he spend several million dollars on promoting the forum? To increase activity and all that. Or create some kind of system that would reward quality posts financially, or ultimately give users cash prizes.And where are these bitcoins spent at all?

comments.author: dbshck
comments.body: Yes https://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=155000.0Quote from: theymos on March 19, 2013, 06:23:02 PMI have pledged to invest all after-expenses BTC-denominated forum profit back into the forum or the community. Due to BTC price increases, forum profitability, and conservative spending, there is a substantial reserve of forum-earmarked funds, currently about 1226 BTC. The cold-storage addresses are bc1qj33689f6edzjst72w6nzs02qd0w68spw49qgcv and bc1q9md45gnwykdkf2r79fdzxyrs96rwejq5nkpca6, though due to accruals the actual amount of forum-earmarked funds might be somewhat higher or lower than the amount in these addresses.Note that the balance of the forum's old donation address is not meaningful, and cannot be added to the above figures. Also, the old multisig arrangement which was previously detailed in this post is no longer in place.

comments.author: un_rank
comments.body: Quote from: eristica.com on December 05, 2024, 04:01:15 AMWhy then doesn't he spend several million dollars on promoting the forum? To increase activity and all that. Or create some kind of system that would reward quality posts financially, or ultimately give users cash prizes.The forum no longer auctions ad spaces so will not generate revenue from promotions. Bitcointalk has also always maintained the position of not promoting to attract users and increase traffic.An idea to reward quality post will raise so many subjective arguments on what is quality. If one chooses to go by merits, it will lead to increased merit farming and will overall influence the posting habits so much that the forum might lose any originality it has now.- Jay -

comments.author: pakhitheboss
comments.body: Quote from: eristica.com on December 05, 2024, 04:01:15 AMsnip..You've had this account since 2017, so I assume you've checked the topics occasionally. If you haven't, it seems you were never truly interested in Bitcoin or the forum. What I don't understand is why you're asking such foolish questions and why you seem to envy the wallet of the owner. If you had believed in Bitcoin when you registered your account and had remained active here, you would have earned a significant amount of Satoshi simply by participating. Now that Bitcoin has surpassed $100K, it looks like you've become greedy and a bit unsettling.

comments.author: ingiltere
comments.body: I like this simple version of the forum, where we can easily read and participate in discussions. We can even make money by advertising in our signature area. The forum has given this opportunity to its members. Why should theymos spend money to promote the forum?The forum doesn't sell ad spaces anymore, because they don't need it. Members can also block ads in the signature area if they want. Considering all the ads popup everywhere in other forums, this feature alone is enough to use this forum. I hope this forum survives for many years to come because this is where the history of Bitcoin lies. Reading the discussions, especially in the early days, is something I enjoy doing from time to time.
